page.title: 05Clubs(2) - Fellowship Group
page.content:
{Clubs}- The{Fellowship Group - by Antonia Payne
On Tuesdays, at seven o'clock, most of the young people meet at Pytchley School. Our ages range from seven to fourteen years. As we enter, we pay ten pence. We gather and talk and then are quiet. We sing a songs and then we say our prayers. These are lead by Father Gatenby, our vicar. We then play{games}such as Ladders, Bulldog and Kingball. Later we have refreshments of orange and biscuits. This is followed by{discussion}groups. We talk about things that are going on in the world and how we can prevent bad things happening when we are older. We go home at half past eight.
